Posts.Content: Call Basha's --- Message edited by CancerCompass staff: for personal protection, phone number removed. Please review CancerCompass Member Guidelines at http://www.cancercompass.com/common/guidelines.html ---- MOM is their Mobil On Site Mammography vehicle. It's a digital mammogram for $130.00, and you don't need any Doctor's Authorization to get it done. I didn't/don't have medical insurance and went had a mammo done last December. I will do the same this year as well. Bashas Grocery stores have in store clinics in all their locations each month. Just call the above phone numbers and schedule with them to have a test done. Or go to Bashas and pick up Bashas "Fresh Is Best" magazine where the store ads are, and in there is a complete list of tests, locations, times and prices. Lynda
Posts.Title: Can't Seem to Get Help Getting a Mammogram

Posts.Content: State Program Offers Free Health Screening to Women mammograms, pelvic exams and pap tests through the program. ... Arizona Department of Health Services to provide the free cancer screenings. ... http://www.azdhs.gov/news/2006-all/freehealthscreening.pdf Arizona Department of Health Services: Division of Public Health ... We can provide free screening services. Free treatment is also available for women that ... be a woman,; for breast cancer screening (mammogram, etc. ... http://www.azdhs.gov/phs/oncdps/wellwoman/qualify.htm
